p: In addition to ONNV, other viruses with potential to cause febrile disease if transmitted to humans or other vertebrates have been isolated from Anopheles, including Nyando virus [ 18, 19], Batai virus [ 20], Japanese encephalitis virus [ 21], Myxoma virus [ 22], and West Nile virus [ 23]. During a recent epidemic, Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV) was present in Anopheles females, males, and larvae, indicating vertical transmission [ 24, 25].
